basics.name: Jamison Kissh
basics.label: Azure Architect
basics.summary: Jamison is an Azure Architect serving clients at PwC. He's a former systems administrator with Boston University Questrom School of Business.

work.name: PwC
highlights: Served as the chief architect for an Azure migration and replatforming iniative
Led a team to create Azure Policy definitons and CI/CD pipeline to release policies for a Fortune 500 client
work.summary: As a manager in PwC's Microsoft Platform Engineering practice, I oversee the technical delivery of Azure projects for clients

work.name: PwC
highlights: Created automation to reduce manual effort during disaster recovery activities including testing and disaster declaration
Built Azure cost optimization analysis on Azure Databricks for repeatable Azure billing data analysis
Designed and built an automated deployment for a globally distributed data platform in Azure using Terraform and Jenkins
work.summary: Consulted with organizations on cloud strategy and implementation, focusing mostly in Azure.

work.name: PwC
highlights: Performed a large scale Azure design and implementation for a large utility company
Designed and implemented a hosted data analytics service for a Fortune 500 client

work.name: Boston University Questrom School of Business
highlights: Selected and implemented VMware Horizon DaaS offering for students
Assisted in selection and responsible for implementation of VMware Disaster Recovery as a Service (vCloud DRaaS) for key services within Questrom
Assisted in planning and oversight of classroom AV modernization and standardization while introducing new collaborative spaces and technology
Implemented server administration and automation with Ansible
Implemented Nagios monitoring engine for Linux and Windows servers
work.summary: Responsible for the day to day operations of the Questrom School of Business' IT systems

work.name: Boston University Questrom School of Business
work.summary: Adjunct instructor for new IS 223 "Information Systems in Context" class for the Fall 2014 and Spring 2015 semesters.

awards.title: 2015 Dean's Award for Outstanding Contributions to Operational Excellence
awards.awarder: Boston University Questrom School of Business Dean's Office
awards.summary: Inaugural award given to two staff members for exceptional contributions to the daily operations of the school.

certificates.name: Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert
Exam 533: Implementing Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Solutions
ITIL Foundation Certificate in IT Service Management
